snippet: Lower-income households in particular worried about their future finances, in contrast to richer households, which were more optimistic as increases in stock prices raised net wealth.
abstract: Survey shows that consumer sentiment unexpectedly dipped in Nov 2013 to nearly a two-year low as lower-income households worry about their job prospects and financial outlooks, and negative views of government linger.
lead_paragraph: Lower-income households in particular worried about their future finances, in contrast to richer households, which were more optimistic as increases in stock prices raised net wealth.

headline.main: U.S. Consumer Sentiment Slid Further in November
headline.print_headline: U.S. Consumer Sentiment Slid Further in November
